intro: Evolvulus hirsutus, commonly known as the hairy blue morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and produces small, funnel-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which contribute to its common name. It thrives in warm climates and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Evolvulus hirsutus is cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
